III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that
there are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements reviewed.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please
note that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHHS
Contract/Policy requirements reviewed.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
 The program manager did not complete a TB test because she is not in the
house more than four hours per week. It was recommended that all employees
receive the TB testing to ensure no issue arise.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not seek consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
The facility submitted one corrective action plan during this period under review. This
corrective action plan was in response to the special investigation 2022C0214003
dated 11/9/2021. This investigation involved staff not using an appropriate and
approved techniques to restrain a youth. The allegation was substantiated, and the
facility submitted a CAP which was approved on 11/23/2021. The approved CAP
involved a retraining of all staff in the approved behavior management techniques.
The second part of the action is a weekly review of the techniques occurring at shift
changes. The facility will have the program manager document and review these
changes. These actions were reviewed during the unannounced visits at the facility.
Chief Administrator Assessment
This document outlines the issues presented with the youth served from the Office of
Refugee Resettlement. The facility was able to adjust the program to serve these
youth appropriately. The facility has incurred two restraints and significant property
damage from these youth. The facility is investing into a new model (Trust Based
Relational Interventions) in an effort to improve the services to the youth. This report
1

documents their completion of the CAP for the special investigation, and this has
been supported during the quarterly unannounced visits.
Interviews
Interviews were conducted with the staff present but no youth were interviewed since
there are no youth currently in the facility. The staff reported being supported by
administration and believe the new programing will provide the best help for youth.
Administration reported being focused on identifying ways to be supportive and train
the staff to deal with any situations that occur.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract and policy. It is
recommended that the facility be issued a renewal of their regular license.
